Special service offered by the library
The Mattituck-Laurel Library has a collection of over 100,000 books, movies, music and more. Patrons can browse the collection and reserve items right from their mobile devices.
Enter keyword to look for items in the library catalog
Enter or scan an ISBN to search for items
Search the library\'s collection and the collections of any public library in Suffolk County. You can also request items be place on hold if the are unavailable or request items from another library
Expand Search to All Suffolk Libraries:
The library shows outstanding films at 01:30 pm every Friday.
The Mattituck-Laurel Library\'s goal is to provide quality services and programs in an effort to meet the informational, academic, and recreational needs of our patrons and the community.

Purchase discounted tickets for the atlantis long Island Aquarium in Riverhead, one of Long Island\'s top year-round tourist attraction. Tickets are $14.00 each for all ages. Purchase tickets at the Library\'s reference desk. Tickets do not expire-can be used all year long.
A digitalized copy of census taken by the Lawton Company of Maine for a Southold Town-Shelter Island Register. The census was taken during the summer 1910.

A digitalized copy of the Gildersleeve Scrapbook collection and donated by the late Donald Gildersleeve of Mattituck. The scrapbook consist of newspaper clippings from local North Fork newspapers. There are 22 scrapbook covering the years 1915–1982.
An index of marriage announcements located in the Gildersleeve Scrapbook Collection and an alphabetical index of marriages by the Mattituck Presbyterian Church from 1884–1934.
An index of obituaries published in the Suffok Times for the years 1900–2011 and an index of obituaries listed in the Gildersleeve Scrapbook Collection.
A digitized collection of historic Suffolk County newspaper including the long Island Traveler and Mattituck Watchman.

Mattituck-Laurel Library cardholders, 18 or over and in good standing are eligible to check out Museum Passes. You can reserve a pass in person at Reference Desk or you can call 298–4134, Ext. 5. to reserve a pass. Museum passes may be reserved two months in advance and are limited to one pass at a time per family.

Passes are typically borrowed for three days: pick up on day one, use the pass on day two, and return it on day three. Passes must be returned to the reference desk. Passes may not be placed in the book or media return drop.

In order to ensure that the Museum Pass is available to the next patron, a $5.00 late fee will be assessed after 11 a.m. on the due date each day thereafter. Please call the reference desk if there is a problem returning the pass on the scheduled day.

Each participating museum sets its limit. Borrowers are advised to visit each museum\'s website for information on parking hours of operation and directions. Each museum reserve the right to determine the rules governing the use of its pass.
Mattituck-Laurel Library cardholders may borrow passes to the following museums:
The Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum
Children\'s Museum of the East End(CMEE)
Mattituck-Laurel Library has computers available for public use.

Eight workstations are available in the reference room of the library for adult/teen patrons. Eight laptop computers are also available for adult/teen use in the library.. Microsoft Office 2007 and Microsoft Works is available on all computers.

Eight laptop computers are available for tweens between the ages of eight and twelve in the children\'s room. A valid library card is required to check out a Tween laptop. Microsoft 2007 is available on computers.

Three iPads are available for in library use to children between the ages of three and twelve. A valid library card is required. Three laptops are available for parents to use in the children\'s room. A valid library card is required.
A copier/fax machine is located near the main entrance:
.55 cents to send the first page and .50 cents for each additional page.

Individuals can have faxes sent to the library fax machine 298–4764. Please have your name and phone number included on the cover sheet. Circulation Desk staff will notify patrons for whom faxes are received. The changes for a received fax is 50 cents per page.

Scan books, documents and photos in multiple formats including: pdf, searchable pdf, jpg, tiff and word. Scans can be saved to a USB drive, e-mail, iPad/tablet or smartphone. There is no charge for this service. Two cannon flatbed scanners also available for public use in the reference area.

Print virtually any document or web page from your internet connected PC to library Hot Spot printer. Print job(s) will be available for up to 72 hours from the time they are sent, and can be retrieved during regular library hours.
The cost is .25 cents per page printed.
The library\'s collections of book, movie and more is constantly expanding. However if, you think there is a specific item the library should order, please fill out the form below.
Optionally if you would like to provide your email address, the library send you a confirmation when the item has been ordered

Mattituck-Laurel Library patrons can verify their library record information below to receive account notification such as fines, holds and when your library card will expire.
Please note that some accounts may have issues validating. Please call the library at (631)298-4134 if you experience persistent issues.
